intro: Polystachya graminoides, commonly known as the grassy spikegrass, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes many flowering plants with complex reproductive structures. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, linear leaves and clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are typically small and borne in dense spikes, often with specialized pollination mechanisms. Polystachya graminoides thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
